happinesse man life doth consist far onely enjoyment thing yield man full satisfaction content wit man good god sight expressed verse onely fear god walk wayes thereupon freedom quietly contentedly chearfully enjoy use portion outward blessing god hath afforded without anxiety vexation spirit wherewith men perplex nothing better man eat drink said seeing thing labour endeavour men much vanity vexation spirit whereby evident thing happinesse full contentment cannot attained best remedy therefore prescribed vanity best way taken become master utmost comfort worldly thing afford man contentedly enjoy portion god hath allotted liberally make use hath support life also pleasure delight afflict many daring enjoy gotten though withall know shall leave even outward thing might thus used conducing men comfortable living world would expect created conferred upon depend upon happinesse seek full content uncertain thing make excessive taking delight others afflict toiling thought sinful known god hath many wonderful wayes discover punish curse rich neither king noble peer none great estate high place thy bedchamber thy intimate friend thy wife lyeth thy bosom thou art upon went solomon often formerly prescribed cure vanity thing men quietly comfortably enjoy good blessing god hath afforded refreshing sheweth ought likewise make use relieving refreshing others others conceive thus former chapter shown available true wisdom towards men living much comfort tranquillity mind midst vanity life teacheth men avoid displeasure prince sheweth available charity end shewn wisdome directs men carry towards superior sheweth likewise directs men carry ought towards inferior namely want cast thy bread upon water bread may meant men provision food may comprehended necessary fot support men life men casting bread meant giving freely relief poor see note pro bread may meant seed cast thy bread sow thy seed either therefore word cast thy bread upon water solomon intends men liberally give alms poor given seed sown fruitful ground land lately moistened abundance rain heaven ground lie close upon river usually yield great increase according following word understood thou shalt find many dayes wit seed alms thus sown shall last yield plentiful harvest god certainly sooner later abundantly reward else rather aim enjoyn giving alms withall covertly answer objection men corrupt heart wont make cast thy bread upon water good thou hast least hope receiving recompence though alms thou givest may seem clearly lost cast away cast sea though may seem unlikely yield thee profit husbandman cast seed river hope reaping thence plentiful harvest thou givest way able requite thee unthankful never remember good thou hast done vile wretch altogether unworthy relief yet withhold thy hand giving thou shalt find many dayes thine alms shall returned encrease thee though reward come presently yet waite certainly come last ebbing water carry away brought back seed sown seems lost doth many dayes bring plentiful harvest thou givest kind thou shalt unexpectedly sooner later find recompenced thee god may make men able willing requite thee ever sure recompence thee yet may thy child childrens child least heaven thou shalt sure abundant reward vers give portion seven also eight c god hath inabled thee give thy provision estate many many distributing every
